column5: Duffy I need Your E- mail address Thanks
TNS,My e-mail is [email protected]. Love to hear from you.Duffy
Thanks for all the responses TNS

Looking for a lodge with the potential of catching a 20# pike. I have my own plane and would like to find a lodge with a runway (dirt, grass, approximatley 2000 ft long ). Any sugestions please reply.

Although there are some still swimming in Ontario, you will have a much better chance in northern Manitoba, and Sask. Here is a web site for lodges in Manitoba. Some may have a runway for you, look for lodges north of 50. www.mloa.com
Try North Shore LODGE and AIR STRIP on EAGLE LAKE ONT.They have a real nice grass runway,and they will put you on some very nice pike,many could be what you're looking for. GOOD LUCK

Fly into Red lake(YRL) 5,000 foot paved runway. Pick any camp on Gullrock Lake. Early spring is the easiest time to catch a big female coming off the spring spawn. Remember to release her so that others can enjoy the same thrill.

North American Bushman outfitters can put you on Lake Evans in Quebec. Highest percentage of huge pike I have ever seen. Personally took a 49" 29# pike on a fly rod. All C&R. Fly to Matagami, Quebec and they will fly you to Evens. www.NorthAmericanBushman.com

Talking to guides at Molson Lake in Manitoba, and suppossedly their outpost Max Lake is really good. Knee Lake of course, but again word is your best to do a fly out from their main lake too. Just what I've heard from guys who have worked there.
This months issue of In Fisherman has a list of the best big pike waters in Canada, you might want to check it out.

The lodge that I work for has many 20lb pike and a sand runway that was once used in the 50's and 60's to fly gold out the bush. We also used the strip in the 90's to fly guests into our camp. E-mail me if you would like more info. Good luck
